text:
I launched a set of JMeter servers on several PC with a client on one of
them.(Client environment: Windows 2000 server, jre1.4.1 jdk1.4.1, jmeter2.1.1)

When launching the jmeter console and trying to use the "remote start" command ,
It has not response.

jmeter log is:
2006/01/23 14:55:10 INFO  - jmeter.engine.ClientJMeterEngine: sent host
=192.168.11.23 
2006/01/23 14:55:10 ERROR - jmeter.engine.ClientJMeterEngine: 
java.rmi.MarshalException: error marshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
	java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error
	at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.invoke(Unknown Source)

	at org.apache.jmeter.engine.ClientJMeterEngine.run(ClientJMeterEngine.java:125)

write error

creator: nicole_nie@trendmicro.com.cn
sebb@apache.org
text:
Are you running the *exact* same version of JMeter on all systems?

Are there any spaces in any of the JMeter home directory paths?

Presumably you ran jmeter-server on all the remote systems?

What do the JMeter server log(s) contain?

I am sure Jmeter are exactly the same version because I copied the zip file to
all the client machines, and I am sure JMETER_HOME are correct.(I set all the
client environments at the same time)

Jmeter server can ran without any bugs. Below is Jmeter server's log:

2006/01/23 14:45:36 INFO  - jmeter.util.JMeterUtils: Setting Locale to en_US 
2006/01/23 14:45:36 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: Version 2.1.1 
2006/01/23 14:45:36 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: java.version=1.4.1 
2006/01/23 14:45:36 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: Locale=English (United States) 
2006/01/23 14:45:36 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: Copyright (c) 1998-2005 The Apache
Software Foundation 
2006/01/23 14:45:36 INFO  - jmeter.engine.RemoteJMeterEngineImpl: Starting
backing engine on 1099 
2006/01/23 14:45:37 INFO  - jmeter.engine.RemoteJMeterEngineImpl: Bound to
registry on port 1099 
2006/01/23 14:57:44 INFO  - jmeter.engine.RemoteJMeterEngineImpl: Reset 
2006/01/23 14:57:44 INFO  - jmeter.engine.RemoteJMeterEngineImpl: received host:
192.168.11.23
creator: nicole_nie@trendmicro.com.cn

text:
are there any firewalls installed on any of the systems?  also, the systems
should all be on the same subnet, otherwise it won't work.

peter
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
nicole_nie@trendmicro.com.cn
text:
It's a local VLAN, so it has no firewall.

I forgot one thing:
 JRE of the controller is 1.5.0.
 JRE & JDK of the clients are 1.4.1

But I think it wasn't a problem since Jmeter 2.0.2 worked quite well. I just
want to upgrade jmeter but it couldn't work.

I got to leave now because it too late now in China, anyway, Thanks for your
hard work & kindly help. See you

if previous versions worked with different JVM, it was most likely coincidence.
I would recommend using the same version JVM. Using different JVM versions with
RMI usually requires custom serialization code to make sure it all works
correctly. I know that with jmeter 2.1 and 2.1.1 using different JVM didn't work
for me. I had to use the same jvm version.

peter
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com

text:
The Locales are also different. I doubt this will affect startup, but might 
affect the Listeners.
creator: sebb@apache.org

sebb@apache.org
text:
What directory have you installed JMeter in?

The test plan seems to be in:

C:\Backup\Performance Test\jakarta-jmeter-2.1.1

which has a space in it.

Try getting rid of the space on client and server.

It's okay now after I get rid of the blank.

Thanks a lot for your kindly help.
creator: nicole_nie@trendmicro.com.cn
